name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

flavorText: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

strengths: Metronome can copy powerful attacks early game
weaknesses: Metronome costs 3 energy on a Basic
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - Quick Metronome access

competitiveHistory: Clefairy was primarily valued as the evolution basis for Clefable. While Metronome is interesting on a Basic, 40 HP made it too fragile to invest 3 energy into. The Rare Holo rarity made it a collectible card in the set.

rulings.ruling: Metronome copies the attack exactly but ignores energy costs and additional costs like discarding.
Clefairy remains Colorless type even when copying an attack from another type.
Sing only puts the Defending Pokemon to sleep on a heads flip.
